text:
Setup :

protected final static String WRAPPER_FQN = ServletUtilities.class.getName();

Function to setup a log file 

public static void setLoggersRollingFile() {
		//%l: Outputs source code location information. Shortcut for %C.%M(%F:%L). 
		//%C: Outputs the fully-qualified class name of the caller issuing the logging
request. 
		// Example: For the class name "org.apache.xyz.SomeClass", the pattern %C{1} 
		// will output "SomeClass". {1} means "output last one component of the
fully-qualified class name". 
		// If no {n} is there, full class name is output by default. 
		//%M: Outputs the method name where the logging request was issued. 
		//%F: Outputs the file name where the logging request was issued. 
		//%L: Outputs the line number from where the logging request was issued. 

		//String pattern = "%-5p %d %C{1}.%M(%F:%L).  %x: %m%n";
		String pattern = "%-5p (%t) %d %M(%F:%L).  %x: %m%n";
		boolean append = true;
		PatternLayout layout = new PatternLayout(pattern);

		//cat = Logger.getLogger(TestLogging.class);

		RollingFileAppender appender = null;

		if (System.getProperty("file.separator").equals("\\")) {
			// Os is Windows based
			try {
				/*
				log4j.appender.lidbNT=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.Threshold=DEBUG
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.File=C:\\APPS\\IPT\\log\\Lidb\\Lidblog4j.log
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.layout.ConversionPattern=%-5p %d %l - %m%n
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.Append=true
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.MaxFileSize=100KB
				log4j.appender.lidbNT.MaxBackupIndex=2
				*/

				appender = new RollingFileAppender(layout,
"C:/APPS/IPT/log/Lidb/Lidblog4j.log", append);
				appender.setMaxFileSize("1000KB");
				appender.setMaxBackupIndex(15);
				//appender.setThreshold()									;

			}
			catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}

			cat.addAppender(appender);
			//cat.setLevel((Level) Level.DEBUG);
			cat.warn("Identified as NT and started using LOGGER category of LIDBNT");
		}
		else {
			// Os is Unix based
			try {

				appender = new RollingFileAppender(layout,
"/data/ipt/LidbLog/Lidblog4j.log", append);
				appender.setMaxFileSize("1000KB");
				appender.setMaxBackupIndex(15);
				//appender.setThreshold()									;
			}
			catch (Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}

			cat.addAppender(appender);
			//cat.setLevel((Level) Level.DEBUG);
			cat.warn("Identified as UNIX and started using LOGGER category of LIDBUNIX");
		}
	}


Problem :

When the program starts it logs properly all the information we want and as time
goes on it started not to write the calling function ( Pattern being "%-5p (%t)
%d %M(%F:%L).  %x: %m%n").


The log looks like the attached ... and as time goes on all function trace is
lost.... Is there some workaround ?
